contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Parcs naturels français.svg|thumb|300px|French national parks (in purple) and [[Regional natural parks of France|regional parks]] (in green).]] The '''national parks of France''' is a system of ten [[national park]]s throughout metropolitan [[France]] and its [[overseas department]]s, coordinated by the government agency ''Parcs Nationaux de France''. The French national parks protect a total area of {{convert|3,710|km2|mi2}} in core area and {{convert|9,162|km2|mi2}} in buffer zones in metropolitan France. This puts over 2% of the total area of metropolitan France under some level of protection. French national parks draw over seven million visitors every year. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name !class="unsortable"|Photo !Department !Area !Established |- | [[Vanoise National Park]]<br/>(''Parc national de la Vanoise'') | [[File:Vanoise National Park.JPG|175px|]] | [[Savoie]] | {{sort|{{commas|1250}}|{{convert|1250|km2|sqmi|0|abbr=on}}}} | 6 July 1963 |- | [[Port-Cros
